intro: Rhynchospora caesionux, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant features slender, grass-like stems with spike-like inflorescences that bear small, three-lobed flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense clusters at the base of the plant. Rhynchospora caesionux plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
